00020 #include <stdio.h>
00021 #include <stdlib.h>
00022 #include <errno.h>
00023 #include <string.h>
00024 #include <sqlite3.h>
00025 #include "libphonefirewall.h"
00026 #include "logfile.h"
00027 
00028 int evaluate_stmt(sqlite3_stmt *pp_stmt,
00029                   struct Entry *p_entry)
00030 {
00031         int num_column;
00032         int count;
00033         char *col_name;
00034         char *col_value;
00035         int tmp_priority = 0;
00036         int tmp_country_code = 0;
00037         int tmp_area_code = 0;
00038         unsigned long long tmp_number = 0;
00039 
00040 
00041         num_column = sqlite3_column_count(pp_stmt);
00042         col_name = sqlite3_malloc(2 * num_column * sizeof(const char *) + 1);
00043 
00044         for ( count = 0; count < num_column; count++ ) {
00045                 col_name = (char *)sqlite3_column_name(pp_stmt, count);
00046                 col_value = (char *)sqlite3_column_text(pp_stmt, count);
00047                 if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_PRIORITY) ) {
00048                         tmp_priority = atoi(col_value);
00049                 } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_COUNTRYCODE) ) {
00050                         tmp_country_code = atoi(col_value);
00051                 } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_AREACODE) ) {
00052                         tmp_area_code = atoi(col_value);
00053                 } else if ( 0 == strcmp(col_name, TB_NUMBER) ) {
00054                         tmp_number = atoll(col_value);
00055                 }
00056         }
00057 
00058         if ( PRIO_ALL == tmp_priority ) {
00059                 if ( tmp_country_code == (p_entry->country_code)
00060                                 && tmp_area_code == (p_entry->area_code)
00061                                 && tmp_number == (p_entry->number) ) {
00062                         return 1;
00063                 }
00064         } else if ( tmp_priority <= (p_entry->priority) ) {
00065                 if ( tmp_country_code == (p_entry->country_code)
00066                                 && tmp_area_code == (p_entry->area_code)
00067                                 && tmp_number == (p_entry->number) ) {
00068                         return 1;
00069                 }
00070         }
00071 
00072         return 0;
00073 }
00074 
00075 int add_entry(int country_code,
00076               int area_code,
00077               unsigned long long number,
00078               char *name,
00079               char *reason,
00080               int priority,
00081               int listflag)
00082 {
00083         if ( priority < PRIO_ALL
00084                         || 0 == country_code
00085                         || 0 == area_code
00086                         || 0 == number ) return -1;
00087 
00088         char *listname;
00089         switch (listflag) {
00090                 case WHITELIST_FLAG:
00091                         listname = "whitelist";
00092                         break;
00093                 case BLACKLIST_FLAG:
00094                         listname = "blacklist";
00095                         break;
00096                 default: return -1;
00097         }
00098 
00099         sqlite3 *db;
00100         char *errMsg = 0;
00101         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];
00102         int rc;
00103         char error[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00104 
00105         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00106 
00107         if ( rc ) {
00108                 sprintf(error, "Can't open database: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00109                 write_logentry(error, "phonefirewall", ERR_FLAG);
00110                 sqlite3_close(db);
00111                 return -1;
00112         }
00113 
00114         sprintf(stmt, "INSERT INTO %s (%s, %s, %s, %s, %s, %s) VALUES(%d, %d, %d, %lld, \"%s\", \"%s\")",listname, TB_PRIORITY, TB_COUNTRYCODE, TB_AREACODE, TB_NUMBER, TB_NAME, TB_REASON, priority, country_code, area_code, number, name, reason);
00115 
00116         rc = sqlite3_exec(db, stmt, NULL, 0, &errMsg);
00117         if ( SQLITE_OK != rc ) {
00118                 sprintf(error, "SQL error: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00119                 write_logentry(error, "phonefirewall", ERR_FLAG);
00120                 sqlite3_close(db);
00121                 return -1;
00122         }
00123 
00124         sqlite3_close(db);
00125 
00126         return 0;
00127 }

00129 int rm_entry (int country_code,
00130               int area_code,
00131               unsigned long long number,
00132               int listflag)
00133 {
00134         if ( 0 == country_code
00135                         || 0 == area_code
00136                         || 0 == number ) return -1;
00137 
00138         char *listname;
00139         switch (listflag) {
00140                 case WHITELIST_FLAG:
00141                         listname = "whitelist";
00142                         break;
00143                 case BLACKLIST_FLAG:
00144                         listname = "blacklist";
00145                         break;
00146                 default: return -1;
00147         }
00148 
00149         sqlite3 *db;
00150         char *errMsg = 0;
00151         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];
00152         int rc;
00153         char error[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00154 
00155         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00156 
00157         if ( rc ) {
00158                 sprintf(error, "Can't open database: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00159                 write_logentry(error, "phonefirewall", ERR_FLAG);
00160                 sqlite3_close(db);
00161                 return -1;
00162         }
00163 
00164         sprintf(stmt, "DELETE FROM %s WHERE %s = %d AND %s = %d AND %s = %lld", listname, TB_COUNTRYCODE, country_code, TB_AREACODE, area_code, TB_NUMBER, number);
00165 
00166         rc = sqlite3_exec(db, stmt, NULL, 0, &errMsg);
00167         if ( SQLITE_OK != rc ) {
00168                 sprintf(error, "SQL error: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00169                 write_logentry(error, "phonefirewall", ERR_FLAG);
00170                 sqlite3_close(db);
00171                 return -1;
00172         }
00173 
00174         sqlite3_close(db);
00175         return 0;
00176 }
00177 
00178 int check_entry(int country_code,
00179                 int area_code,
00180                 unsigned long long number,
00181                 int priority,
00182                 int listflag)
00183 {
00184         char *listname;
00185         switch (listflag) {
00186                 case WHITELIST_FLAG:
00187                         listname = "whitelist";
00188                         break;
00189                 case BLACKLIST_FLAG:
00190                         listname = "blacklist";
00191                         break;
00192                 default: return -1;
00193         }
00194 
00195         sqlite3 *db;
00196         char stmt[STMT_SIZE];       // The SQL statement as text string.
00197         sqlite3_stmt *pp_stmt = 0;  // The prepared statement
00198         const char **p_tail = 0;    // The unused part of stmt
00199         int rc;
00200         char logmsg[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00201         int found_flag = 0;
00202 
00203         struct Entry *p_entry = &entry;
00204         p_entry->country_code = country_code;
00205         p_entry->area_code = area_code;
00206         p_entry->number = number;
00207         p_entry->priority = priority;
00208 
00209         rc = sqlite3_open(DB_FILE, &db);
00210 
00211         if ( rc ) {
00212                 sprintf(logmsg, "Can't open database: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00213                 write_logentry(logmsg, "phonefirewall", ERR_FLAG);
00214                 sqlite3_close(db);
00215                 return -1;
00216         }
00217 
00218         sprintf(stmt, "SELECT %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s FROM %5$s ORDER BY %1$s, %2$s, %3$s, %4$s", TB_PRIORITY, TB_COUNTRYCODE, TB_AREACODE, TB_NUMBER, listname);
00219 
00220         rc = sqlite3_prepare_v2(db, stmt, sizeof(stmt), &pp_stmt, p_tail);
00221 
00222         if ( rc != SQLITE_OK ) {
00223                 sprintf(logmsg, "SQL error: %s", sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00224                 write_logentry(logmsg, "phonefirewall", ERR_FLAG);
00225                 sqlite3_close(db);
00226                 return -1;
00227         }
00228 
00229         while ( rc != SQLITE_DONE ) {
00230                 rc = sqlite3_step(pp_stmt);
00231                 if ( SQLITE_ROW == rc ) {
00232                         found_flag = evaluate_stmt(pp_stmt, p_entry);
00233                         if ( found_flag == 1) {
00234                                 switch (listflag) {
00235                                         case WHITELIST_FLAG:
00236                                                 sprintf(logmsg, "Number \"+%d %d %llu\" accepted successfully.", country_code, area_code, number);
00237                                                 break;
00238                                         case BLACKLIST_FLAG:
00239                                                 sprintf(logmsg, "Number \"+%d %d %llu\" blocked successfully.", country_code, area_code, number);
00240                                                 break;
00241                                         default:
00242                                                 sprintf(logmsg, "Something goes wrong...");
00243                                 }
00244                                 write_logentry(logmsg, "phonefirewall", INFO_FLAG);
00245                                 break;
00246                         }
00247                 }
00248         }
00249 
00250 
00251         // Cleaning up
00252         sqlite3_finalize(pp_stmt);
00253         sqlite3_close(db);
00254 
00255         return found_flag;
00256 }
